page.title: 04Reclamation of Exmoor
page.content: Exmoor before 1820 was barren.It was bought by John Knight and taken over by his son Frederick in 1825. In the early 19th century Sir Frederick Knight tried to cultivate Exmoor for farming purposes.He had mixed success but some of his projects such as Larkbarrow were abandoned.Sir Frederick went bankrupt and the land had to be split in 2 and eventually to the fortesques. Two examples of his projects,one success,one failiure: Red Deer Farm (once an Inn called Gallon House)was a successful farm on the main road from Simonsbath to Exford. Larkbarrow farm was probably started in the 1850's and abandoned in the 1870's,it was owned by Farmer Hays and then Farmer Meadows.
